text: Prime Minister your announcement today
what's the aim behind it
well the UK is one of the great centers
of shipbuilding and were expanding that
now I think that shipbuilding is a area
of industry which is of a massive
promise for this country were
exceptionally good at it
we make loads of frigates that used in
there in Australia the the Canadians are
buying them and we're now announcing
another five type 31 a new type of
frigate and there's going to be built at
shipyards around the UK so they drive
high quality jobs are here in in the UK
the shipbuilding program but they also
represent a massive export of duty for
this country if we could turn to what
happens in a No Deal scenario exit No
Deal scenario the document out yesterday
that shows there could be
fuel shortages food shortages even civil
unrest are you really willing to impose
that on the British people well it's
very important to understand Vicki what
this document is this is a worst-case
scenario which civil servants obviously
have to prepare for but in the last few
months and particularly in the 50 days
since I've been Prime Minister you'll be
massively accelerating our preparations
we're trying to get a deal and I'm very
hopeful that we will get a deal with our
European friends
on October the 17th or 18th or all
thereabouts but if we have to come out
on October the 31st with No Deal we will
be ready and the ports will be ready and
the farming communities will be ready
and all the industries that matter will
be ready for a No Deal brexit and what
you're looking at here is just the
sensible preparations that the worst
case scenario did you expect any
government to do in reality we will
certainly be ready for a for a No Deal
brexit if we have to do it I stress
again that's not where we intend to to
end up but you can't be sure can you of
what that scenario is going to be no one
can be sure and people reading that
document particular those who rely on
medicines regularly they're going to be
incredibly concerned well that's why
it's so important to stress this is a
worst-case scenario
written by planners so that we can look
at everything that we need to do to
ensure that that doesn't happen and what
we've been doing in the last few months
is getting ready in every possible way
whether it's in aviation or medicine
supplies or farming or whatever so that
we are ready on October the 31st so that
this country can come out of the EU come
what may and deliver on the referendum
results let's turn to the Scottish
courts that ruling yesterday do you
think that judges are interfering in
political matters do you think that the
judiciary is independent figure I think
the the British judiciary the United
Kingdom is one of the great glories of
our Constitution they are independent
and bulimia around the world people look
at our judges with with all aberrations
so I'm not going to quarrel or criticize
the judge
I clearly though there are two different
legal views the the high court in
England I had a very different opinion
and the Supreme Court will have to
adjudicate in the course of the next few
days or I think it's proper for
politicians to let them again on and do
that one of your ministers said he felt
people were questioning judges well it's
very important as I say that we respect
the independence of the judiciary they
are learning people it's very very
important that we were there's a
separation of powers in this country and
judges have their views obviously we I
disagree with the particular opinion
that it's comfortable but there's going
to be a further adjudication by the
Supreme Court and we should wait and see
what they say so finally did you lie to
the Queen when you advised her to / oak
to suspend Parliament absolutely not and
that an indeed as I say that the High

us but the Supreme Court will have to
decide we need a cream speech we need to

we are discussing shipbuilding we're
gonna be launching a five new type 31

technology on our vision for investing
in in science space program all the

stopping the export of of waste overseas
and plastics there are a huge number of
things that we want to get on with and
do you can't do that we'd be going on in
this Parliament now for longer than any
time since the Civil War
we need a Queen's speech we need to to
get on with these the Parliament will
have
both before and after that crucial

about the brexit deal I'm very hopeful
that we will get a deal as I say at that
crucial summit we're working very hard
I've been - you know I've been around
other European capitals talking to our
friends I think we can see the rough
area of a landing space of how you could
do it it will be tough it will be hard
but I think we can get there and the

I really hope we can if we can't then we
will be ready to come out on October the
